definition: lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
to bring to deadlock/to result in a stalemate
dead but showing no signs of rigor mortis/to die hard (idiom)/to die yet not be vanquished (idiom)
the larva of silkworm with batrytis

sentences.english: Nick, her charming and successful husband, became a bolter.
sentences.chinese: 她赋有魅力而且事业成功的丈夫这时却成了脱僵野马。

sentences.english: Orpheus froze in place, but he didn't turn around.
sentences.chinese: 俄耳甫斯径直就僵在了那里，但他并没有回转身。

sentences.english: After my blowup it was really rocky for a while.
sentences.chinese: 我爆发之后，有一阵子关系还真僵。

sentences.english: Talks between the two sides, brokered by the U. S. ambassador, have reached a stalemate.
sentences.chinese: 由美国大使说合的双方谈判陷入僵。

sentences.english: Nick, her charming and successful husband, became a bolter. "And he was a real bolter.
sentences.chinese: 她赋有魅力而且事业成功的丈夫这时却成了脱僵野马。

sentences.english: I've been sitting all day. My shoulders get so stiff.
sentences.chinese: 坐了一整天，我的肩膀都僵了。

sentences.english: In the chess, the horses and the generals can't fight.
sentences.chinese: 棋盘里，车无轮马无僵，叫声将军提防提防。

sentences.english: Sometimes in order to take good pictures, face all smile stiff, effect is very bad.
sentences.chinese: 有时为了拍好照片，脸都笑僵了，效果很不好。

sentences.english: My grip froze me to the windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 我紧抓着窗沿，整个人僵在那里。

sentences.english: Effect of mineral nutrition on development of stiff lotus( Nelumbo nucifera Gaertn. )were studied.
sentences.chinese: 分析了僵藕发生与矿质营养的关系。

sentences.english: He's brought things to a deadlock.
A paralyzed character is frozen in place and unable to move or act.
sentences.chinese: 麻痹的脚色会僵在原地无法进行移动或动作。

sentences.english: The smile froze on her face.
sentences.chinese: 笑容不自然地僵在她脸上。

sentences.english: My wife, dead and flat, in 1920 furs.
sentences.chinese: 我妻子，死了，僵躺着，穿着1920年的裘皮大衣。

sentences.english: You’d better be patient, or you might bring things to a deadlock.
sentences.chinese: 你最好耐心一些，否则会把事情搞僵了。

definition: variant of 繃|绷[beng1]/variant of 繃|绷[beng3]
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
to have a taut face/to pull a long face/to look displeased
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
